result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at $0.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment. If defendant has previously provided a DNA sample, Court WAIVES this condition, including related surcharges.

12-07-15/ Judge William Brash
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by changing eligibility for CIP and WSAP to NON-ELIGIBILITY for CIP and WSAP.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job. Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Janice R.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Anger management assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Junior Stehofsky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, calendar successor, for review. mag

Decision and Order DENYING Motion To Remove No Contact Order; Received, filed and signed by the Court on March 31, 2017.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to remove no contact order.

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing 07-29-2015 received and filed. (23 Pages.) CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  STATE PRISON SYSTEM.
Reflects 12-07-15 Court order changing eligibilty for CIP and WSAP to non-eligibilty for CIP and WSAP
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking amendment to JOC (vacating eligibility for early release programs).

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.   If defendant has previously provided a DNA sample, Court WAIVES this condition, including related surcharges
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Janice R.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Anger management assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Upon request of defense, matter rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense wishes to proceed with a plea.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the repeater enhancer dismissed. As to Count 1 as amended:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court ordered the jury trial date of 08/17/2015 vacated.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and defense still waiting for victim's medical records.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney just appointed and needs time to go over discovery materials.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Motion Hearing.  Defense renews motion to withdraw as the defendant is still requesting new counsel.  The state takes no position.  The Court grants motion to withdraw.  Attorney Kulkoski to notify the public defenders office of the need for appointment of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense motion to withdraw heard.  Defendant is requesting new counsel.  
The Court holds colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant requests additional time to think about his request.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky not in court, in custody (Milwaukee Secure Detention).  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  David Behm for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JANICE R. OR HER RESIDENCE
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joseph Junior Stehofsky in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
